title: Abandoned manor overlooking the ocean gets new life in Nahant â€” thanks to Instagram
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The Howe Mansion in Nahant, a historical Queen Anne-style estate, is listed for $5.5 million after a thorough renovation.
Real estate developer Ricky Beliveau restored the mansion following a suggestion on Instagram to save the abandoned property.
The renovated Howe Mansion now has a modern interior with a wine lounge and home theater, while retaining historic elements.

title: Review & setlist: Natalie Merchant strips back the music in support of Beverly’s Grateful Friends
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Natalie Merchant performed a stripped-back concert at The Cabot in Beverly on November 9, 2025.
The concert benefited Grateful Friends, supporting cancer patients by providing essentials like gas and grocery cards.
Merchant's set included minimal accompaniment, revisiting songs without replicating their original arrangements.

title: ‘Confusing’: What readers think of hybrid traffic lights
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Massachusetts currently has about 40 pedestrian hybrid beacons installed to improve pedestrian safety, but drivers find them confusing.
UMass Amherst research shows 65% of drivers incorrectly proceed through flashing red lights, risking pedestrian safety.
A Boston.com poll shows 59% of 300 respondents do not understand the hybrid traffic lights, indicating a need for better education.

title: 230 UMass Amherst students displaced after fire at off-campus apartment complex
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A three-alarm fire at a construction site spread to an apartment complex, displacing 230 UMass Amherst students.
Multiple explosions and a collapsed crane were reported; the building was demolished after becoming structurally unstable.
No injuries were reported; emergency assistance is being coordinated by the Red Cross and Massachusetts Emergency Management Agency.

title: Gabriela Coletta Zapata says she has secured Boston City Council presidency
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Gabriela Coletta Zapata announced she has secured enough votes to become Boston City Council president starting January.
Coletta Zapata represents East Boston, Charlestown, and the North End and won her 2025 reelection with 82.5% of the vote.
Current president Ruthzee Louijeune supports Coletta Zapata, who aims to restore trust in the council amid past controversies.

title: Local obituary: Henry Oberlander, 29, standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers and Bridgewater State
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Henry David Oberlander, 29, from Norwood, MA, passed away on November 5, 2025, due to an automobile accident.
Oberlander was a successful wrestler at Xaverian Brothers High and Bridgewater State, earning multiple accolades and serving as team captain.
He graduated with a psychology degree in 2020, later pursuing Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, coaching, and working in his family's engineering business.

title: Boston.com readers share how the reduction in flights has impacted their travels
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport experienced significant delays and cancellations due to FAA's air traffic reduction prompted by the government shutdown.
Over the weekend, Logan saw 920 delays and 197 cancellations; airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds.
Readers reported canceled flights, extended delays, and some avoiding air travel entirely due to the disruptions.

title: Former Patriot Damien Woody made a bold prediction after New England’s win vs. Buccaneers
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots improved to 8-2 after a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers, tying for the best AFC record.
Former Patriots player Damien Woody predicted the AFC's path to the Super Bowl will go through Foxborough.
The Patriots' seven-game winning streak supports their return to prominence in the NFL, according to ESPN analysts.

title: Western Mass. police chief arrested in school parking lot, allegedly tried to solicit sex from undercover cop
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Cheshire Police Chief Michael Alibozek was arrested for allegedly soliciting sex from an undercover cop in a school parking lot.
Alibozek was placed on paid administrative leave; his firearm and access to the police station were revoked.
An emergency meeting was held to appoint an acting chief; Alibozek faces a court hearing on related charges.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Tewksbury crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 56-year-old Dracut man was critically injured in a motorcycle crash in Tewksbury Friday night.
The crash occurred near Brook Street and Janet Avenue; the motorcyclist was found unconscious in nearby woods.
The injured man was airlifted to Lahey Hospital and Medical Center where he remains in critical condition.
